etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Defiance (Ohio) Democrat. From pit + -er

definitions: A device which or person who removes the pits or stones from fruit.

etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in The Edinburgh Review. Either shortened from pitter-patter, or variant of patter

definitions: To make a rapid succession of light taps, or similar slight sounds; to run with quick, light-sounding steps.
